Data.name: Cause
Data.value: Storm Related Damage, Tree in Line

Data.name: EstimatedRestorationUTC
Data.value: We are experiencing a major outage event and are unable to provide ETRs at this time. ETRs will be updated as they become available.

Data.name: DistrictBroadcastMessages
Data.value:
[{"BroadcastMessageId":93,"Created":"2025-02-25T21:33:13.4806225+00:00","MessageText":"Our crews have continued to make great progress today on restoration efforts after last night’s windstorm. We’ve restored power to more than 90% of the customers who lost it over the past 24 hours. The PUD has mobilized crews from every PUD office as this storm impacted all areas we cover. More than 25 crews remain in the field and nearly all of the damage we’ve assessed has a crew assigned for repairs.
Here are some details on current restoration work:
- We have a crew finishing up on a significant job on Seattle Hill Road in Mill Creek that will restore power to more than 2,000 customers.
- Another PUD crew is finishing up on a job in Woodway that will restore power to more than 100 customers.
- A crew is working on repairs on OK Mill Road east of Machias. This job will likely take the rest of the day to complete.
- We have a line crew and tree crew working on repairs on Camano Island.
- We have a crew working on repairs along Ben Howard Road near Sultan. "}]

Data.name: Cause
Data.value: Tree in Line, Storm Related Damage

- We have a crew finishing up on a significant job on Seattle Hill Road in Mill Creek that will restore power to more than 2,000 customers.
- Another PUD crew is finishing up on a job in Woodway that will restore power to more than 100 customers.

Data.name: DistrictBroadcastMessages
Data.value:
[{"BroadcastMessageId":93,"Created":"2025-02-25T21:33:13.4806225+00:00","MessageText":"Our crews have continued to make great progress today on restoration efforts after last night’s windstorm. We’ve restored power to more than 90% of the customers who lost it over the past 24 hours. The PUD has mobilized crews from every PUD office as this storm impacted all areas we cover. More than 25 crews remain in the field and nearly all of the damage we’ve assessed has a crew assigned for repairs.
Here are some details on current restoration work:
- We have a crew finishing up on a significant job on Seattle Hill Road in Mill Creek that will restore power to more than 2,000 customers.
- Another PUD crew is finishing up on a job in Woodway that will restore power to more than 100 customers.
- A crew is working on repairs on OK Mill Road east of Machias. This job will likely take the rest of the day to complete.
- We have a line crew and tree crew working on repairs on Camano Island.
- We have a crew working on repairs along Ben Howard Road near Sultan. "}]
